comment.body:
> I can't find `nicovideo.jp/api/logger?` or `nicolive.cdn.nimg.jp/relive/sp/trackingService.` request even with mobile UA and logged in.

My bad.
I didn't explain myself well enough.
Those two were used on `sp.live.nicovideo.jp` ,not `sp.nicovideo.jp`
example: `https://sp.live.nicovideo.jp/watch/lv344865419`
I just looked at the logs about the tracker,`nicolive.cdn.nimg.jp/relive/sp/trackingService.` is still in use, but I didn't see `nicovideo.jp/api/logger?`
As for the latter, maybe it has been discontinued.

comment.body:
>This seems to be a config, can we intercept it?

If you use AdGuard app (Android/Mac/Windows) or Firefox extension, then you can try to use a `$replace` rule to modify it, for example:
```adblock
 ||payback.de^$replace=/"disableAds":"false"/"disableAds":"true"/,document
 ```
 though I'm not sure if it will have any effect in this case.
 
>Additionally: there are loads of empty leftovers

Please provide link where these empty leftovers occurs, I don't see them on the main page.

comment.body:
I guess that the problem is like mentioned in - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/176461#issuecomment-2044374109
>[...] it looks like that some scriptlets are executed too late [...]

As far as I can see, new rule is already in Base filter (that's probably why I didn't have to add it, I mean my comment - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/176461#issuecomment-2044495504), and if I disable it, I can reproduce these popups, but with with rule enabled, popups are blocked on my end.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://tools.google.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftools.google.com) ### Comment > Einige für das Chrome-OS relevante Domains werden von Adguard DNS Personal/Team, als Werbung eingestuft, die Domains werden von der Adguard-Liste sowie von einigen Drittanbieter Listen gesperrt. > > Hier findest man eine Liste aller System relevanten Chrome-OS Domains: > > https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/14113552?hl=de#bypass_lists > > Das Ganze ist als Feedback gedacht, bitte nicht falsch verstehen, ich hatte mich gewundert das keine Updates mehr möglich waren und bin dann auf die obere Liste gestoßen. > > Wenn man die Domains aus der bypass Liste als Ausnahmen einträgt läuft Chrome OS wieder einwandfrei. > Die Einstufung als Werbung ist demnach falsch. > > MfG > ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ijwy7d0yemo8sss4ws4wwscc8kc0g84ljpak1b92nk.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/1soq41y3i6sk4400g40swswg00s44443wh8yk49nbm.png?nc=1)

Following two rules are in optimized iOS filter:
```
apple.com##.nr-article-share
apple.com##.sharesheet
```

Could you please check these two rules:

```
apple.com##body .nr-article-share
apple.com##body .sharesheet
```

comment.body:
Categorizing them as advert does not mean blocking them.
AdGuard Home and AdGuard DNS private server use [AdguardTeam/companiesdb](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/companiesdb) to categorize them.

By the way, `clients4.google.com` is not blocked by AdGuard DNS filter.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/172033

comment.body:
> Ad's are popping up all over the place on youtube and other platforms

Please check if AdGuard is detected on https://adguard.com/test.html and tell us about result.

There are multiple duplicate rules in the filter (antiadblock.txt).

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;

- [x] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [x] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/172033

comment.body: Hmm, it's a lot trickier testing using uBO on an actual phone without a physical keyboard. SSAI ads seem to get through on phones, but I'm not sure why it's different from a useragent switch in the browser. I guess you could start checking the logger for the `yospace` domain and see if there are any m3u8 playlists from that domain, then test various m3u-prune combinations. On desktop they just seem to be ordinary mp4 files which are just ads and nothing else. `.mp4` in the filter could probably be replaced by a more specific path.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
